I haven't had a problem with them yet and it always hits the spot.  I prefer this Restaurant over the one in G-Mart.

Went there tonight for date night dinner and we were thoroughly enjoyed it. It's as authentic as you can get in Charlotte. Their Galbi was so great and tender. The kimchi soup AMAZING. The place doesn't look like much when you get there but don't be fooled. It's a quaint little restaurant inside a Korean grocery store. The service was wonderful too.

Came with the kids on a Friday for an early dinner.  Always a good sign when the majority of patrons are Korean.  Bulgogi was a little sweet for my taste, but the seafood pancakes were excellent.  Rice is a great opportunity to shine or disappoint (blow off) and they nailed it. Bipimbop was good, but not great, but after two years in the Bay Area I'm an unfairly harsh critic.  Hitting the expansive adjacent market after our meal was as much a part of the evening as the meal.  It's VERY well-stocked and if you don't leave with a few items you've never tied, you're probably missing the point.

Great place to eat and shop. The food was fresh, hot and filling. The best part about the visit was the authentic preparation and taste. I will be back and genuinely look forward to the next opportunity to venture out that way. The only knock on the place is there are no refills if you get anything other than water which is fine with me.

Awesome food. Best Korean food in Charlotte. Service is hit or miss. Just use the bell at your table if you need anything. 

We have tried all the dishes and the are all good in its own way. If you are not familiar with Korean food or don't eat it often I would jus recommend the following.

Everyone get a 4-5 banchan. They are small sides serve with the entree. They are different each time. Usually alway have kimchi it's a Korean version of spicy sauerkraut. Steamed scrambled eggs, potato with Asian mayonnaise, fish patty. 

Korean BBQ: a must have
Galbi is short ribs
Bulgogi: is thinly sliced ribeye 

Haemul Pajeon (Korean Seafood Pancake) is my favorite.

Japchea is a yam noodle stir fried with veggie and bulgogi beef. Yam noodle are semi clear noodles
With a chewiness to it.

Can't go wrong with kimchi fried rice. 

If you want a different tea, they serve barely tea. It has a slight smoky and sweat taste.
Love this place! Delicious food, friendly staff, unique experience, and a store to boot!

We went inside sat down and ordered our food. Three tables sat down after us and all of them got their food before us. We waited approximately 45 minutes and didn't even get our appetizer. The tables had almost finished eating and we still didn't get our food. They still charged us for the Cokes we sipped on for 45 minutes.

I ventured over with my future Korean mother-in-law for some authentic Korean groceries. I felt a bit awkward in there, being the only white person in an Asian store, but the store associates didn't stare too much. They were quiet and were super helpful when it came to carrying over a large sack of rice to our car -- an Asian staple!

I'm a big fan of Grand Asia Market, so this is like a mini-mart version with mostly Korean brands. The store layout is a little wonky -- the food isn't organized like a normal grocery store. Some of the foods are hard to figure out -- a small portion have English translations, but most I left up to my FMOL to transcribe for me. I lingered around the sweets since I am a sucker for sugar and I don't need English words to tell me what cookies or frozen mochi tastes like! Hehe! I was shocked to discover Korean "pocky" that's called "Pepero" -- not sure if it's a coincidence that the store has the same name... :) We also picked up the staple of all Korean diets: Kimchi! It's pickled cabbage that's fermented for a LOOONG time, but not something I would be able to incorporate into my daily meals (my boyfriend doesn't really like it -- shocking, I know).

Apparently, when you spend over a certain amount here, you get a package of mochi-like treats for free! They're cold, multi-colored, round, and rubbery with a sweet bean paste inside. FMOL popped them like candy, but I stuck to eating one since it's a creepy texture to chew.

I didn't notice that there's an actual restaurant in here until we were checking out! It's hidden behind a set of swinging doors (the kind you see in Westerns). Will definitely have to drop in for a bite next time! Gotta try me some Korean BBQ! ;)

*One safety concern of this store is that the Emergency Exit is completely blocked by boxes. Hopefully they can fix that soon.

While the food at PePeRo was everything I was hoping it'd be and more, the real standout was our server, Aliyah. She horsed around with us all lunch long, cracking jokes, giving out high fives, and making spot on suggestions, including "stop drinking so much water -- you'll pee the bed!" 

Our group of 3 dinners ordered a small kimchi pancake to share and I ordered the pork bul go gi. The pancake, despite getting the small, was huge! We all did our best to make a dent and still left 2 pieces behind. The pork bul go gi was delicious! It was spicy but the rice it came with helped cool my mouth down. I'm going to have a hard time not ordering the same thing every time! 

My friends ordered the bi bim bob and jab chae. I tired and liked both. We also had an assortment of little side dishes. Some were identifiable (is that meat or tofu?!?) but all were tasty. My favorites were the seaweed (which we incorrectly pegged as spinach at first) and bean sprouts/curd. 

Be sure to spend a little time wandering through the attached market either before or after lunch. I spent a good 10 minutes ogling all the foreign-to-me items and went home with some cookies & cream pocky sticks that were a perfect, sweet treat after that spicy pork!

We got harassed today for tips too. I'm familiar with real Korean food taste, so wouldn't say the food here is 100% authentic, but acceptable for American standard. The service was just fair and not remarkable, though the old waitress who served us seemed jumpy all the while and giggling around tables. After paying for our lunch, we wanted to see around the grocery store, and that waitress came to us in the grocery area with the pay slip, saying that it's less than 10% tip and she can't live with so little tip that she doesn't have any salary from the restaurant, asking for more, and left the bill for us to rewrite the tip. We didn't do anything but just put the bill back to the restaurant counter. A few minutes later, she came back again asking us to give more tips! I wonder why the store manager didn't do anything about her harassing customers like this since everyone in the store could see what she was doing to customers, unless she's actually part of the management and pretending not to be one. We could have asked our tip back for what she had done! We insisted politely that's all we could pay for the tip, and she finally left with a disappointed and slightly resentful look on her face. Thanks to her, we lost our interest completely in spending more of our hard-earned money in their grocery shop, nor do we want to go back there at all ever after.

I had Sunday lunch with a friend for my birthday. We were there from 12:30-2:10. The food was great!! The food came out fast, hot, and fresh. The two stars were for the great food!

It was not busy when we got there and yes it did progressively get busy during our stay but our service today was just horrible. Probably with only two waitresses for a busy Sunday crowd of church goers coming in.

We had ordered hot green tea with our food and apparently we only get the small 6 ounce cup and that's it? We asked for a cup of ice water several times with no success. We asked for a refill on hot tea several times as well but the waitress acted confused when she finally acknowledged us, like why are you asking for more, and said she can only give us more hot water. Ok? Often, when I've ordered hot tea anywhere else I often get a pot of hot tea or at least hot water. The waitress accidentally left a cup of ice water that was meant for the table across from us in her frazzled hurry to get us the hot water refill for us, so my friend and I ended up  sharing that cup after it was obvious the waitress was not acknowledging us.

There were six tables at the small section we sat at and our server constantly walked by and checked up on the two tables behind us and the two tables in front of us but did not check on us or look at us. Not once.

When asked for our bill and containers for our food, she went and checked on the table beside us when she came back ten minutes later, gave them our bill, and then took the containers to the other room. While waiting, the couple across from us finally gave our bill when they realized it wasn't theirs. The waitress got flustered when we asked for containers again because she said she already gave them to us. 

When we paid, she asked "Is that was all you pay? This has no tip" and pointed out the amount due on the receipt (we had given her $25 cash plus the remaining $23 or so on debit). We did not leave a generous tip unfortunately because we spent more time waiting for more tea, more water, for the waitress to come by and acknowledge us, our containers, and our bill than we did eating (30 minutes max was spent eating at the most because I was literally just waiting for some service so I could just leave). 

And for the other waitress to come after us and point out that we did not leave a tip and then that our tip was not at least a 10% tip was pretty inconsiderate. We did explain what happened though. She did a apologize for the poor service and acknowledged she would discuss this the waitress. 

Note: the couple across from us left no tip at all!! 

I am by no means a rude customer trying to be annoying or get away with not leaving tips. I try to always be nice, courteous, and considerate to waiters and waitress and give therm the benefit of the doubt but I truly also believe waiters and waitresses need to do their part at the very least. Not just take your order, bring the food and drinks, and then bring your bill.
Lunch was wonderful.   Can't remember the Korean names but we shared 3 dishes and they were all great.   Inside a grocery store.   Well kept secret and dying to go back.
Great lunch enjoyed with my daughter. We enjoyed the food. I had Korean ribs and she had the beef rice. We will be back.

after numerous dreams of spicy squid, my husband enlisted me on a hunt for a korean restaurant that served this dish. thankfully, this place popped up right away with other people who had eaten and craved the very same dish. hallelujah! you saved my marriage again, yelpers! (joshing)

like many asian restaurants that are good (and hole-y), this place is tucked away within a store or shopping area.when you walk in, it's a little confusing. it seemed as if there were 2 seating areas--casual and formal?? i don't know, but we got put in one area over another. not sure if it was because of how many people we had or because we had kids with us. whatevs...

menu was very extensive. i liked that there were options to get bigger or smaller portions. it baffled my husband at first, because he was bummed that the squid dish was almost $20--until i showed him that he was looking at a platter of sorts. he got the squid (obvs), and i got bibimbap. our friends both got the pork dish, of which the name escapes me. everything was super tasty. i could have eaten more kimchi, because it was sooo good. tasted homemade, for sure. 

service was pretty typical of a hole-in-the-wall asian restaurant, but i kind of like that. makes for good stories later.

We had the "Bul Nak Jeon Gol" (beef & octopus  with vegetables in casserole, and Mandu. This is the best Korean dish I've had! 

.

We don't have a lot of Korean restaurants in Charlotte so when I saw this one while I was down in Matthews for an appointment, I immediately decided to go try it. 
The restaurant is part grocery store and has a very low budget feel to it. The front door is actually an emergency exit (which was very misleading) and the actual entrance is through the side door. 
The food was delicious! We ordered the Korean BBQ pork, shrimp fried rice and kimchi pancakes. All of the food was very flavorful and delicious. 
The inside of the restaurant could be a little more lively and clean. My only issue though, was the "silverware" they provided. My parents don't use chopsticks so they were given flimsy plastic forks. I used chopsticks but the ones provided were the disposable kind, very poorly made and splintered. I hurt my hand in three different places. We just gave up and started eating with the steel spoons they gave us for the sauces. Because of that, I only give them three stars.

This place is way too good not to pass up. The restaurant is small. It's inside the market. We ordered so much food. My favorite is still the spicy pork bulgogi. It's came piping hot and the sauce was soooo good. My husband got the beef soup. Broth was spicy and savory. Beef was so tender. The meat fell right off of the bone! One of my friends got the vegetarian fried rice and really liked it. She said the taste wasn't like any other fried rice. Several people got the galbi. You can't go wrong there! The rice cake and fish cake appetizer was delicious. I love all the little samples they give when they serve food. Kimchi and the fish cake is my favorite. My husband loves the bean sprouts and the cucumbers. Can't wait to go back!!
Excellent Korean food - simply the best I've had around the world. The gal bi tang is really good.
Loved it since day one. Very good authentic Korean food, but I particularly love the Spicy Bulgogi. I've tried many versions and theirs is my favorite. It's homestyle for sure. Highly recommend!

I'll admit that I'm not a huge fan of Korean food, but read the reviews and thought I would give it a try. I love a good hole in the wall & this place is nearby. The food was good, and very pretty (my husbands). We had the fish shaped ice cream for dessert and I grabbed a few face masks in the grocery store. 

It's a great little shopping/lunch adventure! Wait time was short and I liked the bell system. No waiting for the check!

Definitely a hidden gem. One would never know this place exists if it wasn't for word of mouth or a quick google search since it's connected to a Korean grocery store and operates in the back. Food is pretty good and authentic.
Great food.  Good service.  The Soon Dae Gook is very authentic.

Disclaimer: this was my first exposure to Korean food. If I could recommend some more expert reviews to read on this, i would say check out Dan C, Ellen O, Peggy C and Christi K's posts. 

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now. Dan C. took myself and some friends here on Monday night. We put him in charge of recommendations and ordering. We got a round of appetizers for our group of five and all different entrees. I don't know what anything is called... so bear with me. App wise kimchi pancake, steamed bun and the wonton-potsticker like goodness. I went with the bbq pork with steamed rice. 

Bottom line: it was all good. The seafood noodle type soup was LOADED with seafood. And best part... it's all a ton of food. We all had leftovers for the next day. Split 5 ways we each spent only $16. What a deal.

Some things to know (for those not familiar with PePeRo or Korean cuisine)

-There's a bell at your table for service.

-Try all the sides that come out with your food.

-If you're coming from Charlotte on Monroe Rd, turn before the restaurant. I drove past it and turned into the driveway on the other side which is actually for another business.

-Go explore the grocery store. 

-Both the store and the restaurant take credit cards. However, please note the grocery store does have a $20 minimum.

-They do have plastic forks for the chopstick-challenged. And by chopstick challenged, I am talking about myself. This is the girl who eats sushi with her hands.

-Don't be afraid to ask questions. Someone can point you in the right direction.

I will definitely be back. I loved the vibe here. It was comforting and kind of felt like getting a homecooked meal at a relative's house.

One of my first times having Korean food. The restaurant is tucked away inside a Korean Grocery store - and while it isn't much to look at, the food was delicious. We were seated quickly and promptly greater by the server.... there appeared to be only the one - but she had the place under complete control. I ordered the Pork Bulgogi. The portion was huge and didn't disappoint - well seasoned with just enough heat. Glad we stumbled upon the place.

Quaint little Korean restaurant inside a grocery store. This place is so much better than the one inside G Mart! 

The hubs and I come here often whenever we get a craving for authentic Korean food and don't feel like driving 3 hours to Duluth, GA (that city is Korea-Town!) 

We pretty much order the exact same thing every time we're here. I keep saying I'll try something different but our usual is so friggin delicious- why risk it? 

We start with the seafood pancake which is loaded with squid, octopus, shrimp, mussels, faux crab and sometimes even scallops. This is served with a soy dipping sauce that perfectly compliments the dish without overpowering it. 

My usual is jjampong, a seafood soup with veggies and Udon noodles. I can NEVER finish a bowl. Even when I share with the hubs and the rugrats, there's still leftovers- there's just so much food in one serving. The dish used to be $10 and they've sinced upped the price to $13, but let me tell you - it's worth so much more than what you pay for. 

The hubs gets bulgolgi cause let's face it - that's a staple and should always be eaten when going to a Korean joint. Not getting bulgolgi is like not getting the fries at McDonald's- you just HAVE to get it! 
The meat is always super flavorful and tender. It's served with Korean rice which is a short grain, slightly sticky grain, similar to what's used in sushi. I enjoy the different texture since I usually eat jasmine rice at home. 

To top it all off, they serve the best ban Chan in the Charlotte area. You get kimchi, cucumber kimchi, seaweed salad, seasoned bean sprouts and my all time fave - stir fried fish cakes. I know I know - sounds pretty weird. But it's delicious! So good that I always purchase some on the side to-go so I can enjoy it when I'm eating Shin Ramen at home. 

There's been a surge of new Korean joints popping up around Charlotte and some are pretty good but none is as authentic as this place. Those new spots cater to the American palette. I prefer the real deal here.

THis is the best Korean place in Charlotte.  It's located on the side of a Korean market.  Its run my a nice Korean family and each dish is prepared with nothing but love.  There isn't a bad thing on the menu.  The people who run this place are so kind and sweet and have a great spirit.  I wish I knew of this place before I wasted my money at Cho Won Garden.  The food is much better and half the price.  We got a small Pancake (which is huge) and 2 big bowls of soup and kim chee assortment which comes with everything for less than $25.  I love this place.  Once you try this place you won't go anywhere else.

Awesome food!! It was fantastic mandoo buns, filled with interesting tastes! 

Ordered ton of foods but filled up with just 3 bites!!
Really awesomeeeee!!!

This is my to-go Korean spot if I want some Korean food.

When you pull into the parking area, don't freak out. It's a store and restaurant put together. Once you enter the store portion, you will be greeted with the clerk but seated by a gentleman. Very kind.

They have a button where you ring them up when you're ready to order, ready for your check or anything so I really like that. Their price are reasonable and I always come for their galbi & bibimbap. So delicious!! Love this place and I hope they do not ever go out of business.

This is some good ol' Korean homecooking!  If you've come a-knockin' looking for the newest trends of truffles atop your kimchi pancake, you can't appreciate the slight doughiness they have here.  Looking for accomodations? Here's a plastic white fork that ostracizes you from the thicket of chopsticks.  At least this place's got ambiance, right...it really sets the mood, right?  Riiiiight.  Splashes of yookgehjahng soup up on my shirt is dead sexy.  Though-despite all its quirks, this place is endearing and serves up some pretty darn good Korean food.  

Came here with some buddies who had never tried PePeRo BeFoRe... sorry, it gets addicting to type like that.  We just ordered a bunch of food off the menu and shared everything.  I thought everything tasted pretty good, but not spectacular.  It's like eating at your friend's house where the Korean food just isn't as good as it is at home.  Here, the daejeegohgi is pretty juicy and tender.  Mandu is okay.  Jjambbohng had plenty of seafood.  But when you put everything together - it hits the spot. PePeRo can definitely hold its own and I see many a craving satisfied with Korean food here. Now only if they served soju and had a karaoke machine...

dmo out.

Tried this place out after seeing it on Eden Eats on food network.  I will certainly go back.  I had the bulgogi and a Kimchee Pancake.  I ordered the small pancake and it  was huge.  The bulgogi was great and the kimchee and vegetables made the meal even better.  They make their own kimchee and I loved it.

Horrible customer service ,  only came here because it was on the way home and so many yelpers gave it goo reviews . I'm part Korean and I love to support locally owned businesses but won't be coming back here again , I suppose if you don't eat Korean often you'll be content with the service or food but I've had so much better.

Being a Korean (and having a Korean mom that cooks the best Korean food) the Naengmyun (cold noodle) and the Jajangmyun wasn't the best, but Galbi, Doobookimchi, and Ddukbokgi was legit. I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants to try real Korean food. Don't be fooled by the sign or the first impression when entering the building. And don't turn left from the door because you'll get lost in all the Asian stuff. The food there and the service is great. Highly recommend it.

The best korean food in the Charlotte area!  It's a small restaurant in the back of an Asian Market, but looks are definately deceiving.   The food is wonderful and the staff is very friendly.  Put that all together with decent prices and you can't go wrong!

Great food but not a real looker, if you are squimish don't go but you'll be missing out on the best Korean food I have ever had.The service is bad but it's all about the food, there is a call button on the table and they come. I'm thinking that this is a family run spot and the food is the real deal, so make a decision do you want delicious food or snappy service and decor, me I always go for the food

I have eaten here 3 times now, two dinners and a lunch. Each time I've ordered something different and it's all been wonderful. The decor is a bit sparse and it's located in back of a Korean grocery store but the food is really good and authentic. Kind of like Korean home cooking. Probably not a good bet if you have a large group as the booths are smallish and they don't serve alcohol.

I have eaten here numerous times. Possibly the best authentic Korean food around. I have tried many of the menu items and have never been disappointed. Keep up the good work, will continue to come again and again.

So fulllll.

I always zoom by this house of deliciousness on the dreaded drive to Wilmington, "tryin to get out before the traffic hits" or "annoyed at all the stoplights lets just get home dammit" so I've never stopped.

Stupid.

Store is full, cheap, and has decent produce. Front door is to the side, don't be nerdy me all scrambling to get in, just head for the green awning.

Obviously Korean in emphasis, with random Jap and Chinese sauces, dumplings, etc (some Viet products as well). Prices were consistent with Super G + Asian Corners. 15 pound bags of rice for cheap. Bags of chili powder, enough to throw a pillow case over and sleep on, 5 bucks.

But the real fun is to be had down the mysterious hallway, "restaurant" sign draped across the door, smells wafting out, battling the dried fish and pickly aromas from the shelves and freezers. Hmm, sesame. Oooh, I hear something sizzling. Big, printed vinyl menu hung sideways, so you have to stoop and stick your head through the window to place an order. Either these guys know exactly how to slay the hole-in-the-wall loving crew or they're a little nuts. Let's go with the latter.

So there's Soondubu, there's BiBimBap, there's fried noodles and fried rice, vegetarians. Pretty sure there's no fried tofu in this joint, only super silky soft. She knew what I was talking about I-no-eat-animals-wise and listed the things they'd leave out to properly fill my order (with a slightly sad face, like she thought I was missing out, awesome). 

And I get more stew than I can possibly, ever eat, complete with pickles of every type - a mild kimchi, sprouts, sweet yam, and not one but TWO poached eggs, gooooood god. Small cup of white rice. I couldn't stop, and now I need a nap.

Love ya PePe.
Absolutely love their food! My favorite dish is the spicy pork with squid! Servers are super friendly. One of my favorite spots to go to.

The only thing I don't like about PePeRo is that they are not in the Detroit area.  My wife and I stayed with the classics and she ordered Bibimbap and I ordered Bulgogi.  They both were delicious and came with the usual small pickled side dishes.  We were in Charlotte for a conference and had seen PePeRo featured on Eden Eats and immediately put it on our To Do list.  Staff was friendly and we noticed a lot of families eating there.  The bonus here was the Korean grocery attached that we could browse through and we bought a few things there as well.  Anytime we are in the Charlotte area we will make sure to stop again.

I have searched high and low for authentic Korean food. I lived in Korea for awhile and became obsessed with the food. Thankfully, I have food Pepero to satisfy my cravings! It is funny that I used to shop at their store for Korean ingredients and didn't realize they had a restaurant in the back! Their Kalbi tang is wonderful!! It is a beef rib soup that reminds me of Korea. The bulgogi and spicy pork bulgogi is awesome too. You get plenty of food for a low price. In awesome Korean tradition they fill the table with side dishes. I love Pepero. The staff is very friendly as well. When you're done, you can explore the market and buy the ingredients to make your own sam gyeop sal or other Asian dishes!

Gross!! If thi is what "authentic Korean" food is like, you can keep it! Oofah!!! Never again. Small, dirty Asian market/eatery. Little flies everywhere and one landed in boyfriend's food, that was done. We ordered the small Seafood pancake which was greasy and full of octopus and surimi (fake crab). Yuck!! We ordered two dishes,  one pork and one beef that someone in the parking lot had suggested to us on our way in and he raved about the food and he was half Korean.  I didn't find it to be any different tasting than what I can cook Asian style. They serve little tastes of vegetables that weren't appetizing or tasty at all. Overall, very disappointing. I'll try Korean again, just not this place. My nail girl in New York makes better food than this. I found nothing appetizing or flavorful here.

I was in such a long withdrawal of authentic Asian food that eating at PePeRo deserved 5 stars! I would give it 10 even for being so close to where I live!

Moving from LA to Charlotte is quite an adjustment, especially when it comes to the food scene. And PePeRo is now my saving grace.

I ordered the Bibimbap and cleaned every speck of the bowl, the miso soup, and ALL the sides. Mind you, I'm a little 5 feet Asian girl.

In summary, it's good ol' Korean home cooking and as a bonus, there's a small grocery store attached where I can conveniently do my Asian shopping!
This is pretty good Korean food especially in the area that I live in! It's close by and I love the little marketplace! I will definitely be returning!
The spicy short rib soup was perfect! The food is definitely authentic in flavor. The amount of food for the money is balanced. I will definitely recommend it! They only accept visa and master card.
Great service.  Friendly staff.  Good food.  Reasonable prices.  You can shop at their grocery store while you wait for the food.
The food is authentic asian fare. Try not to get caught up on the appearance of the restaurant, the food is good. There's lots of flavor in each bite!

Loved it!  This place screams authentic.  Now, I don't think I am the foremost expert on Korean food and judging its authenticity but I can easily say that this was exactly what I was looking for.  A little hole in the wall Korean Grocery store with a quaint restaurant in the back.  It had one section for booths and one section for tables.  Each table had a service bell on the table when you are ready.  Otherwise, the staff will leave you the F alone (which can be nice sometimes rather than being bugged ever two seconds).  

On to the food....  I ordered the Pork Bo go bi (something like that, hahaha).  It was.... BANGING!  It came over some white rice and was cooked in a full-flavored kimchi type sauce.  The spice was perfect for me (not a huge fan of really spicy) and it didn't take over the taste at all.  Just right!  Also, the sides were a perfect compliment.  They were free and they were basically little sample dishes:  seaweed salad, kimchi, sautéed veggies.  Enjoy!

-Ian M.

I have eaten here at least 4 times now, and the food each time was superb.  In the back of the Korean Grocery store, they have a very small restaurant with about a half a dozen tables.  I believe it must the only place left in Charlotte that serves Korean food.  The last time I was there, I had the most delicious Korean Seafood Pancake that had plenty of tasty scallops. Their spicy BBQ pork is also very good, although the spicy BBQ squid was too spicy for me to handle.

My first experience eating Korean food. I must say I was so excited driving 30 minutes in on a rainy day. I walked in and thought its just like the dramas. The smell of goodness was in the air and people were enjoying themselves. I ordered Korean tea, which taste like hot rice and seafood soup &  Veggie buns. The wait was long but it was busy on a Friday night. I think I will stick with green tea, but we ate everything. Then walked around the store like a giddy kid. I bought a body bar of soap with oats, peppermint candy, sweet bun, and my favorite Korean Pears. I don't want to try any other place in Charlotte. I know that is not fair, but it is 2 in 1. Good food and grocery store.

This is always my go to place if I have a craving for Korean food.  People might get confused upon walking in as you'll see a supermarket towards the left, and a kinda restaurant ahead and towards the right (there two rooms for the restaurant).  

This is a pretty poppin authentic place.  On cold nights, order the tofu soup, my fav!!  It's delicious!  My other favorite dish is the jjambong.  I might have spelled that wrong, but it's the seafood noodle soup.  If you order that, I would advise against ordering any appetizers as that is such a big bowl to finish!  If you can finish it within one sitting, kudos to you man...kudos to you.  I never can.  I love this place for the authentic (or as authentic to my knowledge) Korean food in town.  I do love it, but then their kitchen is kind of slow, so be patient when it comes to getting your food.  That is the only reason why they didn't get a full 5 stars from me.  Make sure to order first, and THEN chit chat with your homies.

Check out the supermarket for some fun Korean snacky snacks.  As Professor Umbridge makes Harry Potter write during detention, "I must not tell lies."  I ALWAYS go to the sweet snack section every trip to Pepero.  It's a tradition.  I'm not much of a cook, but check out what other goodies they sell there too.  If you want just a jar a kimchee, they have some for you to buy!  Convenient!

This place is awesome, so go visit it! 

Gomawo! (Informal way to say "thank you" in Korean.  Trust me, I WikiHow'd it.)

Visiting from New York, so I was so happy and lucky to have found this place!  It's more like a hidden gem/ hole-in-a-wall.  A restaurant tucked inside a Korean grocery store.  I ordered the popular dishes -- soondubu jigae, seafood pancake, rice cakes, jap chae, kalbi.  All were delicious!  If you're looking for good Korean food, COME HERE!  (They have a nice bathroom too!)

THIS is the place to go for Korean food!! 

When you first get there, the enterance is to the side where you might see some shopping carts. It's a bit awkward and a little more awkward once you get in because you don't know what to do. LOL! Half of it is a shop and the other half is the restaurant. But you'll be greeted with smiling faces and they'll ask if you're dining and sit you down. Once you've got a seat, it's smooth from there on. 

Pricing is very good, compared to other Korean restaurants I've been to. My dish cost around $9-$11 while at other places it runs to $15.

It feels like eating at home, but with someone serving, cooking, and cleaning for you. The decorations on the wall are beautiful and sometimes they have cute decorations on the table too. All the food is always served with fresh yummy sides. Our favorite sides are the bean sprouts, spinach, and the fishcake (I believe it's fish cake). I always get the same thing each time because I just love it so much: Yuk Gae Jang. You MUST try their fried rice. I don't know why it's so good! It leaves you wanting more after one bite. I love how they serve their water. It's definitely not from the sink.

If it's your first time eating Korean, it's always safe to go with a Kalbi or Bulgogi dish. You can venture out when you're brave enough. And like I said in my other reviews, go with a group, so you can try their dishes lol.  

My niece loves going here because they have a "bell" service where you press a button and a bell goes off in the backroom to let them know if we need anything. They come and check up on you too, so it's not like they're sitting around for the bell.
Pretty good Korean food. Hope to have more side dishes. The kimchi pancake is too spicy for me, but the soup entree are good.

Yuck.  Sorry I know this is the beloved hot spot for many yelpers but I just wasn't feelin' it and I for darn sure don't see the hype.  I couldn't really get past the fact that the place was such a dump.  I get the whole "dive" thing but this was straight up grimy..  I am surprised I didn't see any roaches during my stay but the atmosphere is one that would certainly encourage such a visitor.  

The service was decent, not friendly but somewhat efficient I suppose.

The food was just not my thing.  Maybe I don't like "authentic korean" but even the shrimp fried rice was gross.  The bbq was bland and there was nothing else we tried that was memorable.  I realize I am not an expert when it comes to Korean food but if this is the best Charlotte has to offer then either Charlotte needs more Korean restaurants or I can confidently say I don't enjoy Korean food.

Either way, I wouldn't come back here.

Pepero, You are the Best!! Seriously I'm really really amaze that none of the Charlotte Magazines have try here(maybe it because Charlotte only care about appearance rather then quality), because the really deserve best korean restaurant of Charlotte ! Its so good that it my tradition to go eat ( and shop) here ever Sunday!! Yep your heard me, EVERY SUNDAY!! They're service is awesome and they're food is the BEAST!! soo good! Love you Pepero Family!! xox

My go-to Korean place in Charlotte. I like it because it's authentic, tasty & affordable.
I wish I'm more adventurous when it comes to my ordering, but I swear by the spicy squid over rice. For $10, that's the best darn thing EVER!
Now, let's not kid ourselves, the service here is spotty. My 5-star is mainly for the food and value, and frankly there's not many Korean choices in Charlotte. And hey, after you are done with your meal, you can hop around and buy some groceries!

I had driven past PePeRo many times.  After my recent trip to Seoul, I had to stop in.  It is a grocery store with a restaurant.  I shopped and purchased a few items then returned another day to visit the restaurant.  I have actually enjoyed the restaurant food a number of times.  I make a note of what others are eating (when it looks good) in order to give it a try on my next visit.  I enjoy Bi Bim Bob, Seafood Pancake, Dduk Boy, Yook Gae Jang (spicy soup makes my nose run), and Kimchi Fried Rice.  I have engaged one family member who loves the Kimchi fried rice as much as I do.  Planning a restaurant visit is exciting.  Still, there is no way I can eat as much as others.  Once I have the soup, I can't each much more.    However, I do take home my leftovers and enjoy them for lunch the next day!  

I am giving PePeRo 4 stars because I have nothing to compare them to in the Charlotte area.  That said, they may well deserve 5 stars.
Great soups and kimchi, go for the food not the atmosphere. Loved the kimchi pancakes as well.

Kids menu: N/A, wouldn't recommend for picky eaters but for the more adventurous, you can find good grilled meat and rice options that will expand your kids culinary horizons!

Kids review: The dumplings ("yaki mandoo", fried pork dumplings) were good with the sauce. The rice is really sticky but good. We liked the meat (Korean bbq with rice) the most, it was the best. 

Parents review: We got one order of dol sot bibimbap in the hot pot, it was a little light on meat but so delicious. Loved how the rice got a little bit crispy in the hot pot. The chili sauce was a perfect addition. We also got an order of the spicy pork - huge portion of delicious spicy meat. Not too spicy, just right. The pickle side dishes were delicious and beautifully presented. 

The only downsides were that the decor is a little drab and there's no alcohol served here. Service was great, though. The kids enjoyed the service button on the table - just ring the bell when you need something and someone appears instantly. So cool!

When you're done eating, make sure to stop by the market for some treats - the kids love chocolate pokke sticks and strawberry ramune (Japanese soda).

The food was good and came out quickly which is why I gave it 2 stars. The restaurant itself was so dirty. There were dust balls on the wall near the ceiling and the floor under the tables was quite dirty and the walls looked dingy.

I started eating Korean food about 10 years ago in Grenville South Carolina, I used to eat at a place called Tasty BBQ, when I first went in I thought it was a BBQ joint!
but I was the only American there. They had a nice spread at the counter you ordered from and the pictures of everything on the menu in nice big color shots.
I was only in Grenville for 1 year and came back to Charlotte, my home.

I was looking on yelp and noticed PePeRo a while back  but never went to Matthews,

Yesterday I was browsing through yelp and clicked on Korean and read the recent reviews and decided I had to go tonight!.

The Kitchen was clean and the rating was upper 90s which is rare for Korean restaurants.
The waitress was young and friendly and spoke good English! :)
I decided on the JAE YUK DUP BOB ( spicy stir fried pork over rice)

First out came the little side dishes Koreans eat with their meals, banchan,,
(cabbage kimchi, cucumber kimchi, bean sprout, 2 I could not recognize, so asked the waitress and marinated radish and marinated sprouts0
It came out looking and smelling clean and fresh!
Then came the main dish and a small bowl of Miso soup.
everything was Delicious and fresh and I cant wait to go back.

The menu has each dish pictured with Korean name with English translation below.
They are open until10:00 PM nightly except Sunday until 8:00PM

The kimchi pancakes are deviously delicious! I could have made a meal out of that! We had the spicy pork for two. It came with rice and several other sides that included a fish dish that was delightful. You won't find much in the way of ambiance here, but if you're looking for some authentic delicious Korean food then you should definitely visit. Spend some time perusing the shelves of the grocery store after your meal!

What a wonderful little korean grocery store. So glad I found it. The prices are good, love the little gift section, restaurant is so-so, and selection is not bad. Took off a star because both times I went there, they ran out of economy size kimchi. Wtf? Not acceptable for a korean grocery store. Would be like a pizzeria not offering small or medium pizzas.

I have been here many times, everyone working there is very friendly and helpful ! I've had the  (bulgogi) and the  (galbi) they were both delicious! Have wanted to go a few times on a Tuesday and forget that they are closed on that day! I know better now, :) my fiance and I will continue to come here ! They also have ice cream stored conveniently as you are entering /leaving the restaurant  ^^  Korean ice cream is the best! It's a perfect treat, don't miss out ~ only one thing, I wish they had an outside table so you can enjoy the beautiful summer weather and ice cream at the same time !
This place is absolutely awesome. Definitely try the seafood pancake! If you have any questions feel free to ask any one of the waiters waitresses there more than happy to guide you through the menu.

Well I have to say this was quite an amazing place !! Korean grocery store in the front and Korean restaurant in the back. Service was awesome, the portion sizes are huge for the money and the food tasted great I thought. With that said I thought this place was just a great first time experience for me .... Check it out if you like something different from the beaten path of fast food it's definitely on the top of good

Coming from Atlanta (aka Korean food capital of the Southeast), I was shocked to learn how devoid of Korean restaurants the city of Charlotte is when I moved here. 

My husband and I love Korean, but because Matthews is quite a drive from where we live, it took us some time to finally pay a visit to Pepero. We finally went for dinner yesterday. 

The food was good - it's nothing fancy and certainly not the best Korean I've ever had, but it was reminiscent enough of Mom's home-cooked comfort Korean cuisine. I had the kimchi jjigae, which was pretty solid. 

Pepero is most definitely NOT a restaurant you go to for the atmosphere. The entrance is on the side towards the building's rear, and it's surrounded by towers of boxes from food shipments. It pretty much just feels like you're eating in the middle of a small grocery store...which you technically are if you take away the wall dividing the restaurant from the store. In other words, no matter how much your crush loves Korean food, this is not the place for a first date, folks. 

All in all, I would definitely go back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't drive all the way across town for it. Better start diving into some Korean cookbooks!

Food is good. Of all of the Korean restaurants I've eaten at its in the middle. My problem was the service. No water refills and slow on the food delivery and bringing the check. Walked past the table many times but didn't stop. All in all I would go back.
